replies.bodyText: looks better, but I don't think it's correct: in case of an exception during the transfer, we should not have set transferred=true
replies.author: abstractdog

timeline.bodyText:
Shall we keep the original log message for advancing the file descriptor as well here?
Why do we need the extra fd.valid check here? (maybe leave a comment?)
timeline.author: pgaref

replies.bodyText: hm, thought this over again, fd.valid() change was needed while I haven't been handling deallocate() stuff properly, but now, at this point fd should be valid...initially I left this check here because I thought that an invalid fd is not a problem (which is true, we won't advise to OS cache, and that's it), but as we already have try/catch, we don't need this this check (we'll have the exception in the logs anyway)
replies.author: abstractdog

timeline.bodyText:
I know this is copy pasted from below but do we have a ticket for this?
Is it still needed?
timeline.author: pgaref

replies.bodyText:
I think we don't support SSL shuffle for LLAP at the moment (+ the comment is quite old), e.g. Cloudera's data warehouse, ssl on shuffle is handled transparently by the environment
I haven't touched this part in this patch, and not even sure what's the plan :) that's why I simply kept this as is
replies.author: abstractdog

timeline.bodyText: Why is this need now? How was connection kept alive before ?
timeline.author: pgaref

replies.bodyText:
good catch :) this is an epic workaround for a problem that I haven't been able to figure out 100%, here are some details:
https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/TEZ-4157?focusedCommentId=17100835&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels%3Acomment-tabpanel#comment-17100835
(btw: with netty3, we didn't need this)
are you fine with a comment explaining this?
replies.author: abstractdog

replies.bodyText: Got it, this is helpful but lets make sure this is expected from nettys' side of things before committing -- this would be helpful for the Tez change as well :)
replies.author: pgaref

replies.bodyText: okay, in this case I'll have to include some unit tests here (which are part of tez codebase already) + create a simple repro to share with netty community
replies.author: abstractdog

replies.bodyText: Thanks Laszlo! sounds like a plan!
